comment.author: 35453215@N00
comment._content: This is actually a construction within the 1889 World Exposition Galerie des Machines (Machinery Hall) by Charles Dutert and Victor Contamin. The Galerie des machines was the largest single-span structure in the world when it was built for the World’s Fair on the Champ de Mars in Paris in 1889. The iron building was destroyed in 1910, but in the 1900 World's Fair in Paris it was still around and this Salle des Fetes was built inside it. See my bibliography on it: vrc-cbe-uw.blogspot.com/2008/06/galerie-des-machines-pari... Love seeing the Salle in color - is this a hand-painted lantern slide?
